channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic
channel.description:
I know that the Priest was removed a few months ago, but in hopes of having him back, I made this. BD doesn't have a support class that recharges limited abilities (after that CW change). I planned for the Priest to be conversion immune but there's currently some debate on that topic.
[quote] **The Bishop**
Unique Blue Dragon Support
Goal: Same as all of BD
**_Passives_**
**Devout:** Your voice cannot be tampered with. (Icy Touch, Distract, etc. will not work on you.)
**Faithful:** You cannot be converted starting from Day 6. If you are attempted to be converted after Day 6, you will gain a charge of all limited abilities.
**_Abilities_**
**Blessing:** (Night) (Unlimited) Choose two targets. Any buffing night action done to you (Heals, Guards, Barriers, Sacrifices, Smites, etc.) is done to the targets as well. You will see any feedback that happens if using a buffing night action with successful results.
Ex: Does not see: 14 did not require any healing. Sees: 14 was cured of their Nightshade poisoning.
**Renewal:** (Night) (2) Choose one person and restore two charges on all limited abilities. Will not go over original limit. Will not work unless that person is completely out of charges for at least one limited ability.
Shows Message: "You were renewed!"
Parameters: - Renewal will not affect a Prince's Execute if a BD was executed - Renewal will not work on Physicians' Reanimate
**Consecration:** (Day) (3) Choose one person; prevent any day abilities from targeting them that day, and if the person is affected by Icy Touch or Distract, cancel it.
Exceptions are abilities that affect the night phase, like Imprison and Scout. [/quote]
[quote]
**The Heretic**
Unique Unseen Support
Goal: Same as Unseen
**_Passives_**
**Devout:** Your voice cannot be tampered with. (Icy Touch, Distract, etc. will not work on you.)
**_Abilities_**
**Heresy:** (Night) (2) Choose one member of the Unseen, give them one charge to one limited ability.
**Deceive:** (Night) (2) Have all members of the Unseen appear as not suspicious tonight.
**Consecration:** (Day) (3) Choose one person; prevent any day abilities from targeting them that day, and if the person is affected by Icy Touch or Distract, cancel it.
[/quote]
I don't know what abilities would work very well for the Heretic, and I am not sure if they should be a Support or Social class, and if one is chosen, how abilities should be changed or not.
[poll type=multiple min=1 max=2 public=true] * Consecration * Humility [/poll]
Changelog: - Removed Conversion Immunity from Bishop and Renewal ability @NuclearBurrito - Added Devout Passive - Edited Consecration Ability - Added Voice of Spirits Passive - Changed to Faithful Passive - Removed False Words Passive - Swapped Blessing and Renewal - Changed Heresy Ability - Edited Renewal Ability - Dark Curse Ability to Heretic
**Links to Other Threads**
https://forum.imperium42.com/t/class-suggestion-the-thief-and-the-rogue/25348
https://forum.imperium42.com/t/class-suggestion-the-peasant/31823

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic
item.dc:creator: Sheepish
item.description:
Livicus:

I still like the name Blessing but ok, no unlimited, Priest is becoming a strategic class, but I feel like Blessing is an ability you can’t exactly control so I’ll give a lot of uses to Blessing

Noo! You didn’t get my point. I meant, let’s keep thinking about an unlimited use ability called Blessing and put the one I suggested as the second night ability with a few uses instead of the Renewal one. Get it?
Night Ability 1: Blessing (Unlimited uses)
Does something we don’t know yet.
Night Ability 2: Spread Religion (3 uses)
Blah blah blah share benefits.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic
item.dc:creator: Sheepish
item.description:
Man, your idea is great in my opinion, but for a second night ability, like a limited one, you know?
3 uses. Any heals, guards, barriers, etc. used on you or your target are shared between you both. If he gets healed, you get healed, if you get guarded, he gets guarded. You could even name it something like “Spread the Love” or “Spread the Religion” .

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
What about this?

Night Ability 1: Blessing - Prevent anyone from visiting your target. Anything that happens to you also happens to your target. While using this Ability you are Occupy immune. (Unlimited)

Note: Occupying or redirecting a priest that is doing this will instead only Occupy or redirect the target in the same way.

Read full topic
item.source: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic
item.dc:creator: Sheepish
item.description:
Okay so, here’s what we know:

  1. The Priest will be a Support class
  2. He has to have something related to Blessing. We simply need that.

Knowing that… how do we proceed?
As far as Blue Dragon is concerned, the already existing supports cover the following areas:

  1. Healing.
  2. Reanimating.
  3. Swapping Position.
  4. Protect against negative effects.

Taking my list into consideration, some options that match being Blessed would be:

  1. Grant Death Immunity? (Direct death, not poison/bleed)
  2. Assure that the target will bypass immunities? (That means you can occupy people who can’t be occupied, you can kill who can’t be killed. You just can’t convert classes who can’t be converted, but that’s obvious.) (I know this looks like 4 from my list, but it’s different)
  3. Assure that the target will successfully receive or give beneficial actions? (Heals, Guards, etc…)

Read full topic
item.source: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic
item.dc:creator: Sheepish
item.description:
Livicus:

I mean I find that the difference of a limited Renewal and unlimited Recharge ability is that with Renewal, you’d have to be smart and see what’s really worth recharging. It has strategy. Whereas unlimited Recharge is just spam spam spam, soooo yeah

I’m with you, man. Having limits is good!

Livicus:

We’re working on a second night ability, but yeah, Sheriff doesn’t need recharge, Sheriff is a strong independent man

You go, Sheriff! Lmao

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bishop and the Heretic
item.dc:creator: Sheepish
item.description:
So, just to organize our thoughts:

  1. Conversion immunity idea was denied
  2. Recharging abilities idea was denied
  3. Reanimate idea was denied
  4. Guaranteed success idea was denied
  5. Switching passives idea was denied

I’m trying to think of something here, just posting this to help you guys do the same.

Read full topic
